[[File:Transformative Reactions Damage Comparison Graph.png|thumb|right|300px|Base damage from Transformative Reactions per Level, as of Version 5.1]]

The DMG dealt by [[Elemental Reaction#Transformative Reactions|Transformative Reactions]], the DMG Boost provided by [[Elemental Reaction#Additive Reactions|Additive Reactions]], and the HP of [[Crystallize]] shields are based on the triggering party's '''Level Multiplier''', which is determined by their level.

For Transformative and Additive Reactions only, Level Multipliers for characters is higher than those of enemies and the environment at Level 58 and above.

Additionally, certain damaging environmental effects, despite not being Elemental Reactions, will also scale with the same set of Level Multipliers for their DMG.

==Transformative Reaction Base Damage==
For calculation,

<math>\text{Base Damage} = \text{Reaction Multiplier} \times\ \text{Level Multiplier}</math>

Note: These refer to the same '''Reaction Multiplier''' and '''Level Multiplier''' terminologies as used in the article on [[Damage#Transformative Reaction Damage|Transformative Reaction Damage]].

===Reaction Multiplier===
The reaction multipliers can be derived from internal data.

{| class="article-table"
!Reaction !! Reaction Multiplier
|-
| [[Burning]] || 0.25
|-
| [[Swirl]] || 0.6
|-
| [[Superconduct]] || 1.5
|-
| [[Electro-Charged]]<br>[[Bloom]] || 2
|-
| [[Overloaded]] || 2.75
|-
| [[Burgeon]]<br>[[Hyperbloom]]<br>[[Shatter]] || 3
|}
